vulnerability_report.description: Affected versions are vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) through the `next/image` component.

Affected versions are vulnerable to Resource Exhaustion via the `next/router` component, Open Redirect through specially encoded paths, and Path Traversal allowing access to files in the `.next` directory.

Affected versions are vulnerable to Resource Exhaustion via the `next/router` component, UI Misrepresentation due to improper CSP, DoS when a static asset is requested with a locale prefix, and DoS due to mishandling of invalid URLs.
Affected versions are vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) due to the `dangerouslySetInnerHTML` and `innerHTML` attributes.
Affected versions are vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) when rendering user-provided content with `dangerouslySetInnerHTML` and when using URLs in the `href` attribute of anchor elements.
Affected versions are vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) when rendering user-provided content with `dangerouslySetInnerHTML`.
Affected versions are vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) due to the `dangerouslySetInnerHTML` attribute and unescaped text inserted into the DOM.
Affected versions are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS). This can cause an impact of about 10 seconds matching time for data 100k characters long.
Affected versions are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) due to the sub-patterns `[^]` and `[\s\S]`.
Affected versions are vulnerable to Deserialization of Untrusted Data when passing input through the package due to its default configurations that are missing input sanitization.
